alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Natrona County Lower Elevations; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 5:58PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Natrona County through 630 PM MDT... At 557 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Lost Cabin, which is also 33 miles east of Shoshoni, moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Natrona County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Natrona County Lower Elevations; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains
